intro: Dichaetandra, commonly known as the featherleaf lily, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Iridaceae. It is native to South Africa and consists of several species, most of which are herbaceous perennials. The plants are characterized by their narrow, grass-like leaves and showy, often fragrant flowers. Dichaetandra species typically bloom in late spring or early summer, producing clusters of delicate, tubular flowers in shades of white, yellow, or orange. These plants are valued in horticulture for their ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
